meanings.definition: To create or use a simplified form of language for communication between speakers of different languages.
meanings.sent1: She was pidginising her speech to help her friends understand her better.
meanings.sent2: The linguist was pidginising the text to bridge the communication gap.
meanings.sent3: The teacher tried pidginising the lesson, but it ended up sounding confusing.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character was pidginising his lines to interact with the foreign visitors.
meanings.sent5: The translator was pidginising the document to ensure clarity for all readers.

meanings.definition: The act of adapting a language to make it simpler and easier to understand for non-native speakers.
meanings.sent1: Pidginising can help make complex languages more accessible to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The pidginising of the manual made it easier for new employees to follow instructions.
meanings.sent3: The pidginising of the menu made ordering food a breeze for tourists.
meanings.sent4: The pidginising of the storybook allowed children from different backgrounds to enjoy the tales.
meanings.sent5: Pidginising is essential in global communication to ensure understanding across cultures.
